answers.answer: It could be  carpal tunnel, which is common in pregnancy
It literally wakes me up throughout the night atleast 19 times because my elbows start killing me
My mom told me, that my daughter could be laying on a nerve.. its happened a couple times where i felt like i couldbt move my fingers..

That can Also be  sign of preeclampsia...which cN be teally dangerous for you and the baby. My sister was 36 wks and she kept saying her hands and feetwere tingling. She called her doctor and he hax to do an emergency csection the next morning. I would just play it on the safe side and call your doctor and tell him the symptoms you're having

Yeah thats making me worry more because ive had tingling in both hands and feet but my hands are extremely tingly throughout the whole.day and night it wakes me up and I've been having blurred vision every now and then
I'm 11 weeks & I get that a lot while I sleep too! Maybe 2-4 times a night! Have you talked to your doctor yet?Good luck!!
Mo I havent I see him monday

I had the same problem with my hands and feet. Doctor wasn't concerned. I would just raise my hand over my head for a minute and it went away. I had it happen the whole time I was in labor too. That's when it gets annoying lol

I've been having that too.  Sometimes when I wake up, my hands and arms  are numb and get tingly later. I think it's just the way I sleep and maybe the baby is resting on a nerve. But if you have blurred vision, I think you should get checked up because that's also a symptom of preeclampsia

question: Im 37 weeks and my.hands are.constantly falling asleep getting tingly is this normal
title: worried am I the only one??
